raw_comment:
1. What do you notice? If your notice makes a claim, where in the graph is the evidence to support it?

I notice that the majority of kids send texts to their parents which it is more convenient and easy. I also notice that women are at higher percentage's for all of them compared to men.

2. What do you wonder?

I wonder why the men don't send more texts or phone calls. I also wonder what age range these people are that answered. 

3. What impact does this have on you and your community?

This has an impact on my community because we have phones that have access to reaching our parents but if we don't use them we can lose connection and relationships with people close to us. 

4. What's going on in this graph? Write a catchy headline that captures the graph's main idea.

Do you not have wifi??
ace_sentences: The graph is about kids who contact their parents.
Most kids send text messages to their parents.
Women have a higher percentage than men for every contact method in the graph.
I wonder why men do not send more text messages.
I wonder why men do not make more phone calls.
I wonder what age range the respondents have.
These phones can be used to contact parents.
If people do not use these phones to contact parents then people can lose connection with their parents.
If people lose connection with their parents then relationships with close people can worsen.
The headline is: Do you not have wifi?
